results.title: The Melbourne Games
results.creator_credit: James Murray, Denis Phelan, Video Sports and Golden Years
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Olympic glory: the golden years”.
Live through the unforgettable action for the first time the Olympic Flame blazed in the Southern Hemisphere. This program captures the momentous highs and lows Australians were able to savour first hand. It includes footage of the remarkable first, second and third places captured by Australian swimmers in the women’s 100m final, headed by the fabulous Dawn Fraser. The explosive confrontation between Hungarian and Russian water polo teams, less than three weeks after the Russian invasion. The pride of Betty Cuthbert’s glorious wins in the 100m, 200m and 4 x 100m relay races. Plus all the local magic of a youthful nation hosting the world’s premiere sporting competition. Narrated by Norman May.

results.title: Chocolates, giants and peaches. Parts 1, 2 and 3
results.creator_credit: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner
results.brief_description: Roald Dahl, recorded live at the Dallas Brooks Hall in Melbourne, talks about his writing and reads aloud from his own books, including Revolting Rhymes”, “BFG”, “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory”, “Matilda and “Dirty Beasts”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Statewide School Support, Victoria. Ministry of Education and Lily Steiner

results.title: The Esso Australian Jazz Summit
results.brief_description: Sydney’s famous Bondi Beach came alive with a foot-tapping, head-nodding event, the First Australian Jazz Summit. All styles of jazz were represented, from modern, traditional through to avant-garde. Various ensembles and configurations of players performed, from standard groups to Big Bands, feature soloists and, of course, jam sessions and improvisation. Rated: G

results.title: Home in the high country
results.creator_credit: Trevor Larner and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Trevor Larner first discovered the Victorian high country as a teenager. He initially wanted to get to the highest point, but then fell in love with the vegetation and beauty of the Alpine region. Eventually he started working there maintaining infrastructure, building ski lodges and repairing the huts of the early pioneers. When Trevor went back to visit in 2008, it felt like he was coming home.

results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.

results.title: The Dulugar
results.creator_credit: James Hackell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.

results.title: In search of golden footprints
results.creator_credit: Andrew Swift and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Andrew Swift was raised in a small mining town in the foothills of the Victorian Alpine country. The more he learnt about the history of mining in the region, the more his interest in the remote areas of the Alps increased. Andrew’s exploration of the area has unearthed evidence of the long forgotton gold mines and the stories of the people who worked there.

results.title: How I see it on the street
results.creator_credit: Robbie Williams and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: The way I see it, there are a lot of bums in the world. Stories from a Big Issue vendor who operates from a wheelchair, about the variety of bums in the world and how they behave towards him.

results.title: Homage to the herbster
results.creator_credit: Leo Kane and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Sometimes he inscribes his name in wet cement. As long as he spells it correctly, I’ll let it ride. A simple tale of an intense relationship between a Big Issue vendor and his terrier, his partner in both work and life.

results.title: Junkie's ruminations
results.creator_credit: Kylie O'Brien and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Kylie O’Brien feels society has reviled drug users. She provides an insight to the world through her eyes, as well as through her art and music.
